intro: Bunium alpinum var. eualpinum, commonly known as the alpine fennel, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often umbelliferous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. The flower heads are small and white, forming a flat-topped cluster that attracts pollinators.
